labels.analysis: The OP.GG MCP Server provides a comprehensive suite of gaming-focused tools that deliver data, analytics, and insights for popular games like League of Legends, Teamfight Tactics, and Valorant. Its core functionality revolves around providing competitive data, champion/character analysis, match histories, esports schedules, and meta information to help players improve their gameplay, strategize, and stay informed about the current state of the game.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Gaming" is chosen because the server's tools are exclusively focused on gaming-related data and analysis. Secondary labels include "Data Analysis & Processing" for its analytical capabilities and "Esports" for tools related to competitive gaming and match schedules. A custom label "Game Meta Analysis" is added to highlight its specialized focus on analyzing game-specific metas, champion/agent performance, and strategic insights.

tools.name: lol-champion-leader-board
tools.description: Retrieves the leaderboard of master players who play a specific champion well. You can also look up the high ranked players, like the high winrate 5 players in #1-#30, to retrieve their champion performance or recent match history to teach how to play the champions.

region.description: Regions in the game League of Legends.

champion.description: These are the champion names in the game League of Legends.

tools.name: lol-champion-analysis
tools.description: Retrieves very detailed information about a specific champion, such as win rate, pick rate, recommended builds, recommended skill order, recommended items, etc. If a user mentions a specific champion, you *must* always call this function, review the data, and then respond. If the user asks some tips during playing game, you should also occasionally call this function to advice how to play the game well. If the users asks like 'what items should I buy?', 'which skill should I level up?', also you need to call this function to see the high winrate champions. (Counter Picks ban/pick data is available in the `weakCounters` field). You must assume the position user want to know.

game_mode.description: Different queue types and game modes in League of Legends.

champion.description: These are the champion names in the game League of Legends.

position.description: These are the champion positions in the game League of Legends.

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

tools.name: lol-champion-meta-data
tools.description: Retrieves meta data for a specific champion, including statistics and performance metrics.

champion.description: These are the champion names in the game League of Legends.

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

tools.name: lol-champion-skin-sale
tools.description: Retrieves information about champion skins that are currently on sale.

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

tools.name: lol-summoner-search
tools.description: Retrieves information about a specific summoner, such as their rank, win rate, and recent match history. If a user mentions a specific summoner or wants to know about themselves, you *must* always call this function. If you can't find the summoner, ask to the user which region do they play.

game_name.description: The first part of a Riot ID (e.g., "Annie" in "Annie#Opgg").

tag_line.description: The second part of a Riot ID (e.g., "Opgg" in "Annie#Opgg").

region.description: The region to search in (e.g., KR, NA, EUW).

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

tools.name: lol-champion-positions-data
tools.description: Retrieves the analytics of champions by each positions. You can also look up the winrate, banrate, plays, wins, kills, kda and etc. `tier_data` is champion tier which tells which champion is powerful (OP) or not, for example `tier 1` champion is easy to play and powerful champion. (You can recommend this champion to the user if they want recommandation)

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

format.description: Format of the output data. Determines the format of returned data. Default is `csv`.

tools.name: lol-summoner-game-history
tools.description: Retrieves the recent match history of a specific summoner. If a user mentions a specific summoner, wants to know about their recent matches, wants to know how to improve or wants to get an advice, you *must* always call this function.

game_name.description: The first part of a Riot ID (e.g., "Annie" in "Annie#Opgg").

tag_line.description: The second part of a Riot ID (e.g., "Opgg" in "Annie#Opgg").

region.description: The region to search in (e.g., KR, NA, EUW).

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

tools.name: lol-summoner-renewal
tools.description: Renew the summoner's data of OP.GG through RiotAPI. When you retrieve summoner data, you *must* always call this function first, and then call the next functions.

game_name.description: The first part of a Riot ID (e.g., "Annie" in "Annie#Opgg").

tag_line.description: The second part of a Riot ID (e.g., "Opgg" in "Annie#Opgg").

region.description: The region to search in (e.g., KR, NA, EUW).

tools.name: lol-brawl-champion-tier-rank
tools.description: Retrieves champion tier ranking list in brawl mode.

lang.description: Language code for localized content. Determines the language of returned data.

tools.name: esports-lol-schedules
tools.description: Get upcoming LoL match schedules.

tools.name: esports-lol-team-standings
tools.description: Get team standings for a LoL league.

tools.name: tft-meta-trend-deck-list
tools.description: TFT deck list tool for retrieving current meta decks.

tools.name: tft-meta-item-combinations
tools.description: TFT tool for retrieving information about item combinations and recipes.

language.description: These are the champion names in the game League of Legends.

tools.name: tft-champion-item-build
tools.description: TFT tool for retrieving champion item build information.

championId.description: TFT champion ID to retrieve item build for

tools.name: tft-recommend-champion-for-item
tools.description: TFT tool for retrieving champion recommendations for a specific item.

itemId.description: TFT item ID to get champion recommendations for

tools.name: tft-play-style-comment
tools.description: This tool provides comments on the playstyle of TFT champions.

tools.name: valorant-meta-maps
tools.description: Valorant map meta data

tools.name: valorant-meta-characters
tools.description: Valorant character meta data

tools.name: valorant-leaderboard
tools.description: Fetch Valorant leaderboard by region

tools.name: valorant-agents-composition-with-map
tools.description: Retrieve agent composition data for a Valorant map.

tools.name: valorant-characters-statistics
tools.description: Retrieve character statistics data for Valorant, optionally filtered by map.

tools.name: valorant-player-match-history
tools.description: Retrieve match history for a Valorant player using their game name and tag line.

server_info_crawled.name: OP.GG
server_info_crawled.author: @opgginc/opgg-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: The OP.GG MCP Server provides AI agents with a comprehensive suite of tools that deliver gaming data across popular titles, including champion analysis and rankings for League of Legends, match schedules and team standings for LoL esports, meta deck compositions, item combinations, champion build recommendations and playstyle insights for Teamfight Tactics, as well as map meta, character statistics, leaderboards, agent compositions and player match history for Valorant, along with various other gaming information.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@opgginc/opgg-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
